intro: Anathallis racemiflora, commonly known as the yellow mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant belonging to the Loranthaceae family. It is native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil and thrives on the branches of host trees such as *Inga* and *Cecropia*. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in a raceme, which are typically visited by bees and other pollinators. Its leaves are reduced to small scales, and it absorbs water and nutrients from its host through specialized structures called haustoria. Anathallis racemiflora plays a unique ecological role in its habitat, contributing to the biodiversity of the forest canopy.
